intro: Iris spuria subsp. gueldenstaedtiana, commonly known as the Siberian iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, slender stems that bear lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-blue or purple flowers with three upright petals and three drooping sepals. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wetland habitats.
